dim.defaultFlags.description: The default flags that will be used to generate regexes out of patterns given in rules. Overridable in rules.

dim.defaultMaxLinesBetween.description: This property is deprecated. If desired, regex quantifiers (such as `{0,n}`) can be considered instead.

dim.defaultOpacityTier.description: The default opacity will be assumed for rules that doesn't specify. Overridable in rules.

dim.defaultScanLimit.description: This property is deprecated. Dim now scans only the first 2000 lines of document.

dim.rules.description: List of rules that will be used by dim to decide which part of code will be dimmed.

end.description: This property is deprecated. Please migrate to using "pattern" property. Consider the use of "s" flag for block dimming rules to make dots match newlines.

flags.description: Flag suffix that will be used for generating the regex for given pattern. Dim sets "g" flag by default which matches all instances (rather than the first) of pattern. Consider adding "s" for block dimming rules which makes the dot match with newlines. Don't use a separator between flags. Eg. "gs"

pattern.description: The pattern that will be used to generate regex. Don't forget proper escaping. Eg. "[^\n]" means any character other than the new line. For dimming blocks (rather than parts in single line) it is possible to use dot operator for newlines. See the description for "flags" property.

rule.description: This property is deprecated. Please migrate to using "pattern" property.

start.description: This property is deprecated. Please migrate to using "pattern" property. Consider the use of "s" flag for block dimming rules to make dots match newlines.

dim.updatePeriod.description: The minimum duration waited between two run of Dim for any editor in milliseconds. Lower values makes Dim more reactive to input changes, while might affect overall system performance.

dim.valueForMaxTier.description: Actual opacity value for max opacity rules.

dim.valueForMidTier.description: Actual opacity value for mid opacity rules.

dim.valueForMinTier.description: Actual opacity value for min opacity rules.

description: Define regex rules to dim boring parts of code and make the main logic pop.
name: dim

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
